vision.notes: Visual capabilities in Sphaerotheriidae are not specified in the provided context. Further research is needed.

chemoreception.notes: As millipedes, Sphaerotheriidae likely use chemoreception (smell and taste) for navigation, food detection, and mate recognition. This is inferred from general millipede biology.

mechanoreception.notes: Millipedes rely on touch and vibration for sensing their environment. This is inferred from general millipede biology.
